intro: Mnesithea subgibbosa, commonly known as the waxy leaf mnesithea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
